article.title: axon
article.p:
axon
, also called
nerve fibre
, portion of a nerve cell (
neuron
) that carries nerve impulses away from the cell body. A neuron typically has one axon that connects it with other neurons or with muscle or gland cells. Some axons may be quite long, reaching, for example, from the
spinal cord
down to a toe. Most axons of
vertebrates
are enclosed in a
myelin
sheath, which increases the speed of impulse transmission; some large axons may transmit impulses at speeds up to 90 metres (300 feet) per second.
